abstract: Professional boxing has no single governing body but fights can be sanctioned, for a fee, by World Boxing Council, World Boxing Association, World Boxing Organization or International Boxing Federation, each of which names its own world champions in each weight class; each of these, except for IBF, have sanctioned upcoming welterweight match between Floyd Mayweather Jr and Manny Pacquiao, and winner will be presented with belts from all.
lead_paragraph: An alphabet soup of boxing organizations is involved in Saturday’s championship fight between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao. And they all have a belt to present.

headline.main: For the Mayweather-Pacquiao Winner, a Bevy of Belts
headline.print_headline: Wardrobe of Belts Awaits Showdown’s Winner

snippet: An alphabet soup of boxing organizations is involved in Saturday’s championship fight between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao. And they all have a belt to present.
